greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least prime p with p+2 prime such that n = (q+1)/(p+1) for some prime q with q+2 also prime.
comment: Conjecture: a(n) does not exceed n^2-n+5. Also, the set {(p+1)/(q+1): p, q, p+2 and q+2 are all prime} contains all positive rational numbers.
Clearly, this conjecture implies the Twin Prime Conjecture.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(1) = 3 since 1 = (3+1)/(3+1) with 3 and 5 twin prime.
a(4) = 17 since 4 = (71+1)/(17+1) with {17,19} and {71,73} twin prime pairs.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Jun 11 2015
